intro: Webera bispinosa, commonly known as the two-spined Webera, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine, soft hairs, while its flowers are usually pink or purple, adding ornamental value to its natural environment. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude ecosystems.
